meanings.definition: The act or process of transmitting something
meanings.sent1: The transmission of knowledge from teacher to student is crucial for learning.
meanings.sent2: The radio waves allow the transmission of music to reach listeners far and wide.
meanings.sent3: The transmission of gossip in the school hallway is always entertaining.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a transmission of warmth and kindness to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The transmission of emotions through music can be incredibly powerful.

meanings.definition: The mechanism by which power is transmitted from an engine to the wheels of a vehicle
meanings.sent1: The transmission in the car smoothly transfers power from the engine to the wheels.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic fixed the transmission to ensure the car could drive smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The transmission in the race car was so fast, it felt like flying.
meanings.sent4: The transmission of power in the car was like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The transmission of energy in the vehicle made it zoom down the highway.

meanings.definition: The process of sending and receiving signals, messages, or information
meanings.sent1: The transmission of data through the internet allows us to communicate instantly.
meanings.sent2: The satellite enables the transmission of TV signals to homes around the world.
meanings.sent3: The transmission of jokes in the chat group always brings laughter.
meanings.sent4: The transmission of news through newspapers keeps people informed.
meanings.sent5: The transmission of love messages warms the hearts of those who receive them.

meanings.definition: The act of passing on a disease from one person to another
meanings.sent1: The transmission of the flu virus can be prevented by washing hands regularly.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained how the transmission of the illness occurs in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The transmission of a cold in the office led to many people getting sick.
meanings.sent4: The transmission of the virus was a reminder to practice good hygiene.
meanings.sent5: The transmission of diseases highlights the importance of vaccination.
